title.narrative: Denmark's additional contribution to the Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria 2020, motivated by COVID-19

description.narrative:
The contribution is given to support Global Fund’s core activities as reflected in the Strategy 2017-2022 to attract, leverage and invest additional resources to end the epidemics of HIV, tuberculosis and malaria, strengthen the health system and support attainment of the Sustainable Development Goals, thereby making sustainable and significant contributions to the reduction of infections, illness and death. This project concerns Denmark's financial contribution to the sixth replenishment period 2020-2022.
The priority results defined for Denmark's interaction with the Global Fund are: 1. Ensure the Fund maintains and strenthens its focus on human rights, including equity and gender equality; 2. Maximising the Fund's Impact on Strenghtening Health Systems; 3. Continued institutional Reform and streghtened Risk Management.

title.narrative: Adapt HIV, TB and malaria programs to mitigate the impact of COVID-19 and safeguard progress.
Adapt HIV, TB and malaria programs to mitigate the impact of COVID-19 and safeguard progress.

actual.value: In March 2020, GFATM introduced new grant flexibilities to enable countries to use savings and reprogramming from existing grants to rapidly adapt HIV, TB and malaria programs, purchase protective equipment, procure COVID-19 diagnostics and medical supplies, and strengthen the immediate response to the pandemic. In April, GFATM launched the COVID-19 Response Mechanism with an initial capacity of an additional US$500 million. As of 21 August, grant flexibilities totaling US$184 million had been approved for 92 countries and 11 multicountry programs, while US$514.5 million had been approved through the COVID-19 Response Mechanism to 73 countries and 2 multicountry programs.
